item.title: retired iraq commander to seek texas senate seat
item.description: ricardo sanchez, who rose from a childhood of grinding poverty in south texas to become a three-star army general and commander of coalition forces in the iraq war, planned to file paperwork on wednesday to run as a democrat for a senate seat.

item.title: surgery referrals don't improve state's outcomes
item.description: initiatives aimed at getting more surgery patients sent to hospitals where they have the best chance of surviving may not be accomplishing their goals, at least in washington state, according to a recent study.

item.description: soccer's top international scorer in history is helping to raise twin daughters but trying to remain connected to the sport.

item.description: it's the season for garden plants, and home depot and lowe's are giving you a clearer picture of the plant's needs.

item.title: six years and hundreds of witnesses later, coroner rules in london bombings
item.description: the verdict of 'unlawful killing' was never in doubt in the inquest in the 2007 bombings on london's transit system, which killed 52 people.

item.description: a judge in ottawa approved the extradition of a suspect in the 1980 bombing of a paris synagogue that killed four people, but said the case was weak.

item.title: 'the mountaintop' will come to broadway, with jackson but without berry
item.description: samuel l. jackson will play the rev. dr. martin luther king jr. in katori hall's olivier award-winning play, but halle berry will not appear in the production, producers said, because of "child custody issues."

item.title: casey abrams proud of bringing jazz to "idol"
item.description: ousted "american idol" contestant casey abrams said on friday he was proud of bringing a fresh jazz twist to the tv show, but admitted that his signature growl might have been too much for audiences to take.

item.description: as the pain in his knee persisted for another day, chauncey billups all but conceded that he might not make it back during this series.

item.description: microsoft says its latest quarterly earnings grew 31 percent even as sales of its windows operating system sagged.

item.title: jon bon jovi jewelry burglar arrested
item.description: authorities in new jersey said on friday they arrested a burglar on charges of stealing $500,000 in jewelry and other goods from rock star jon bon jovi and three of his neighbors during a month-long break-in spree.

item.title: show's potions and props bring harry potter to life
item.description: stroll into hogwarts, visit the gryffindor common room and see harry potter's bed in the dormitory he shared with ron weasley in a new exhibition at discovery times square.

item.title: a million fish can die in a night; cleanup takes days

item.title: texas state employees sue comptroller over privacy

item.title: smoking leisurely, and illegally, in the park

item.title: switch off, chip in, be happy, say activists

item.title: idaho miner's body recovered nine days after cave-in

item.description: a silver miner trapped more than a mile underground since a cave-in nine days ago in northern idaho is now presumed to have perished in the accident, mining company executives said on sunday.

item.title: 'rio' soars during strong weekend at the box office
item.description: the animated comedy rio did $40 million to top the box office this weekend, with scream 4 in second place.

item.title: 91-year-old stands by "exit kits" despite suicide furor

item.description: a man who shot dead two convenience store workers in a robbery in 1989 was executed by lethal injection on tuesday, after a legal challenge raising concerns over the drugs used in the execution failed.

item.title: minister slams obama in prayer opening minnesota house

item.title: police search home of charlie sheen
item.description: police searched the home of charlie sheen on thursday looking for firearms that would have violated a court order against him, but they found only bullets and an antique rifle, a lawyer for the actor said.

item.title: alcatel-lucent says demand to remain strong in u.s.

item.title: dialed in and uncle mo favorites for kentucky derby
